page.title: 17FARMING AROUND SANDY LANE
page.content: This is mainly a rural area, but only grass is grown in the fields. The weather and the soil are best suited to grass. The farms are dairy farms. In summer the grass is cut for hay and silage. Tractors pull muck spreaders, cutters and machines which set the cut grass in rows and finally hay balers or silage choppers which then feed the silage into a trailer. At Stocka House Farm they keep 90 cows. The farm is run by the farmer and his son. The herd graze in the fields in summer. The cows are brought into a collecting yard at milking time and are then led, 10 at a time into the milking parlour. Four suction cups are attached to the cows teats and the milk is pumped into a stainless steel container. There is a large barn where the cows are kept in bad weather. A few cattle are raised for beef.
